prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Ema presents the victim's information. We know that all members of the Khura'inist clergy must have been born in the country, and all bear outstanding tattoos, that no one else bears.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair where the evidence and testimony don't align.

First, I need to go through each testimony and check against the evidences. Let's start with the testimonies provided by Ema. 

Testimony 3 says that Puhray Zeh'lot was an illegal immigrant, so they don't know his real name. Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 16 is the Crime Photo (Zeh'lot) which mentions he has a peach-shaped tattoo on his neck. 

Wait, the characters list mentions that all members of the Khura'inist clergy must have been born in the country and have unique tattoos. Since Zeh'lot is an apprentice priest living in the high priest's house (Character 6), he should be part of the clergy. Therefore, he should have a clergy mark. But if he's an illegal immigrant (Testimony 3), that would mean he wasn't born in Khura'in, which contradicts the requirement for clergy members. The evidence about his tattoo (Evidence 16) would indicate he's clergy, but Testimony 3 says he's an illegal immigrant, implying he wasn't born there. So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (illegal immigrant) and the fact that he has a clergy tattoo (Evidence 16), which requires being born in Khura'in. 

Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 16 and Testimony 3. But wait, Evidence 16 is the Crime Photo of Zeh'lot with the tattoo. The testimony is Testimony 3 from Ema about him being an illegal immigrant. That's the contradiction. Because if he's clergy, he must be born there, but the testimony claims he's an illegal immigrant. So that's the conflicting pair.

{"evidence": 16, "testimony": 3}

Person: Tahrust
Testimony 4

Testimony 5
Testimony: I would describe the noise as a terrible crash. Poor Zeh'lot... It must have felt so heavy.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let me try to work through this. So, the task is to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies given by Tahrust. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all listed here. 

First, I'll need to look at each testimony and check if there's any evidence that directly contradicts it. Let's go through the testimonies one by one.

Testimony 0: Tahrust says he was entertaining His Magistry and family when the crime occurred. Evidence that might contradict this... Maybe the Family Photo (22) taken during the Feast of Blessings the day before. But the crime happened during the Purification Rite, which is the next day. Not sure yet.

Testimony 1: Beh'leeb was in the kitchen cooking. The Kitchen isn't mentioned in the evidences. Maybe something else? Like the Tome of Secrets (23) mentions that the person playing Lady Kee'ra (which is Beh'leeb) must know the name Ihmsan. But how does that relate to her being in the kitchen? Not directly.

Testimony 2: Tahrust heard a man and woman quarreling on the tape. The tape isn't listed as evidence here. Wait, the May 9th Newspaper (2) reports on Lady Kee'ra's activities. Maybe that's not related. Or the Bloodstained Letter (5), but it's unreadable. Hmm.

Testimony 3: The altercation was between Zeh'lot and Maya Fey. So, Tahrust claims it was those two arguing. But looking at the evidence, maybe there's something that shows they couldn't have been there. Let's check. 

Maya's Statement (8) says that when she and the Abbot arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. Wait, the Purification Rite involves the Inner Sanctum. The Ritual Curtain (4) was closed during the rite, isolating the sanctum. If the curtain was closed, maybe people couldn't enter or leave. Also, the Sanctum Prayer Flags (6) are sewn into a long banner. Maybe that's part of the setup.

But if the curtain was closed, how could Tahrust hear them arguing? Unless he was inside. Wait, the Inner Sanctum Diagram (15) shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite. If the curtain was up, maybe the sanctum was isolated, so others couldn't enter. But Tahrust was the high priest. Wait, Tahrust is the victim, right? Wait, the Summarized Context says Tahrust is killed during the Purification Rite. So if he was dead, how is he giving testimony? Wait, maybe this is from a séance or a flashback? Because in Ace Attorney games, sometimes testimonies come from channeling or other supernatural means. 

Wait, Tahrust is the victim, so his testimony is probably from a séance or prior statement. Let's assume that. So, he's saying that during the crime (the time of the rite), he heard Zeh'lot and Maya arguing. But Maya's Statement (8) says that when she and the Abbot arrived, the water was already red. Wait, the Abbot is Tahrust, right? Because Tahrust is the high priest. So, if Maya and Tahrust arrived together at the Inner Sanctum and found the water red, which implies the crime had already happened. But Tahrust's testimony 3 says that during the crime, he heard Maya and Zeh'lot arguing. That's a contradiction because if Tahrust and Maya were arriving at the Inner Sanctum when the water was already red (the crime had happened), then how could Tahrust be present during the crime to hear the argument? Unless the timeline is different. 

Wait, perhaps the timeline is conflicting. If the water was red when they arrived, the crime (Tahrust's death) must have occurred before they arrived. But Tahrust's testimony is about hearing the altercation during the crime, which would have to be when he was present. But if he was already dead, that's impossible. Unless there's a mix-up in the timeline. Alternatively, maybe the altercation Tahrust heard wasn't during the crime but before. But the testimony says "when the crime occurred."

Alternatively, looking at the Ritual Curtain (4) which isolated the sanctum during the rite. If the curtain was closed, then Zeh'lot and Maya couldn't have been inside arguing unless they were part of the sanctum. But according to the Inner Sanctum Diagram (15), Maya and the high priest (Tahrust) were in the sanctum during the rite. So if Zeh'lot was outside, how could they be arguing? Because the curtain was closed, so sounds from outside might not be heard inside. Or vice versa. 

Wait, Tahrust's testimony 3 says the altercation was between Zeh'lot and Maya. But according to the Ritual Curtain evidence (4), the entrance was shut during the rite. So if Maya was inside the sanctum with Tahrust, and Zeh'lot was outside, then they couldn't have been arguing in the same space. Therefore, Tahrust's claim that he heard them arguing during the crime (when the curtain was closed) would be impossible. The evidence that contradicts this is the Ritual Curtain (4), but the testimony in question is Testimony 3. 

But looking at the evidence list, the Ritual Curtain is Evidence 4. So, the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 (Zeh'lot and Maya arguing) and Evidence 4 (curtain closed, isolating the sanctum). Therefore, if the curtain was closed, Tahrust (inside the sanctum) couldn't hear Zeh'lot (outside) arguing with Maya (inside?), but wait Maya was inside. Wait, no. If the curtain was closed during the rite, and Maya was inside with Tahrust, then Zeh'lot was outside. So, if they were arguing, one would be inside and the other outside, separated by the curtain. Therefore, Tahrust couldn't have heard them arguing because the curtain would block the sound. Unless the curtain doesn't block sound. But the curtain is meant to isolate the sanctum. Alternatively, maybe the prayer flags (6) are sewn into a banner outside the curtain. Maybe there's a way sound could carry. 

Alternatively, the key contradiction is that if the curtain was closed, Maya and Tahrust were inside, so Zeh'lot couldn't have been there to argue. Therefore, Tahrust's testimony that he heard Zeh'lot and Maya arguing during the crime is contradicted by the Ritual Curtain (4) which would prevent Zeh'lot from being present. 

Wait, but Zeh'lot was killed in the Plaza of Devotion (Evidence 16). His autopsy report (17) says he was stabbed in the upper back. The Warbaa'd Statue (27) is the murder weapon. If Zeh'lot was killed in the Plaza, maybe that's a different location from the Inner Sanctum. So Tahrust's testimony about hearing them argue during the crime (his own murder) would be in the Inner Sanctum, while Zeh'lot's murder is in the Plaza. But how does that tie in? 

Alternatively, maybe the altercation Tahrust heard was not during his own murder but during Zeh'lot's murder. But the testimonies are about the crime (Tahrust's murder). Hmm. 

Wait, the problem states that Tahrust was killed during the Purification Rite, and his testimony is about what he heard during the crime (his own death). So if he was in the Inner Sanctum during the rite, and the curtain was closed, then he couldn't have heard an argument between Maya (who was with him) and Zeh'lot (who was outside). Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (hearing Zeh'lot and Maya argue) and the Ritual Curtain (4) which isolated the sanctum. Therefore, the testimony 3 is impossible because the curtain would have blocked the sound, or prevented Zeh'lot from being present. 

So the answer would be evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) contradicts testimony 3. But let me check the list again. Evidence 4: Ritual Curtain, entrance shut during the rite. Testimony 3: altercation between Zeh'lot and Maya. Since Maya was inside the curtain with Tahrust, Zeh'lot was outside. Therefore, Tahrust couldn't have heard them argue unless the curtain was open. But the curtain was closed. So this is a contradiction. 

Another angle: Evidence 15 (Inner Sanctum Diagram) shows where Maya and the high priest were. If they were inside the sanctum, separated by the curtain, then Zeh'lot was outside. So any argument between them would require them to be in different locations, separated by the curtain, making it impossible for Tahrust to hear. 

Thus, the correct pair would be evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) contradicting testimony 3. Alternatively, maybe the May 9th Newspaper (2) reports on Lady Kee'ra's activities, which might relate to the Tome of Secrets (23) that mentions the role of Lady Kee'ra (Beh'leeb). But not directly contradicting the testimony. 

Another possibility: Evidence 8 (Maya's Statement) says that when she and the Abbot arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. That would mean the crime (Tahrust's death) had already happened when they arrived. But Tahrust's testimony is about events during the crime. If Tahrust was already dead when he and Maya arrived, that's a contradiction. Wait, that's a big one. Let's think. 

If the crime (Tahrust's death) occurred when he was with Maya at the Inner Sanctum, but Maya's statement says that upon arrival, the water was red (indicating blood). That suggests that when they arrived, the crime had already occurred. But if Tahrust is the victim, he would have been alive when they arrived, but the water was already red. So perhaps Tahrust was killed after they arrived. But his testimony is about events during the crime. Hmm. 

Wait, maybe the timeline is: Tahrust and Maya arrive at the Inner Sanctum, find the water red (so the crime had already happened). But Tahrust was the one who was killed, so he must have been alive when they arrived. This seems contradictory. Because if the water was red when they arrived, implying someone else was killed before they got there. But Tahrust's autopsy says he died from an abdominal wound. So perhaps when they arrived, the water was red from Tahrust's wound, but he was still alive? That seems possible. Then, after arriving, Tahrust was killed. But Maya's statement says the water was already red when they arrived. So maybe the initial blood was from someone else. But the main victim is Tahrust. 

This is getting confusing. Let me focus back on the testimonies and evidences. 

Testimony 3: The altercation was between Zeh'lot and Maya. Evidence 8: Maya's statement says that when she and the Abbot (Tahrust) arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. If Tahrust was with Maya, then he couldn't have heard an argument between Maya and Zeh'lot during the crime, because Maya was with him. Unless the argument happened before they arrived. But the testimony is about during the crime. 

Wait, maybe the key contradiction is that if Maya was with Tahrust during the rite (as per Evidence 15 and her own statement), then she couldn't have been arguing with Zeh'lot at the same time. Therefore, Testimony 3 is false because Maya was with Tahrust, not arguing with Zeh'lot elsewhere. So the evidence contradicting this would be Maya's Statement (8) or the Inner Sanctum Diagram (15). 

Looking at the list, Evidence 15 is the Inner Sanctum Diagram showing their positions during the rite. So if they were inside the sanctum, then Zeh'lot was outside, and Tahrust couldn't have heard them arguing. Therefore, Testimony 3 is contradicted by Evidence 15. 

But the user may have expected another answer. Let me check. 

Alternatively, the Bloodstained Letter (5) found at the Inner Sanctum, which is unreadable. If the argument was about the letter, maybe, but not directly. 

Another angle: The Tome of Secrets (23) says the priestess (Beh'leeb) must know the name Ihmsan. If Beh'leeb was in the kitchen (Testimony 1), but the Tome requires her to be present, perhaps that's a contradiction. But not directly related to Testimony 3. 

Hmm. Based on the initial analysis, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (Zeh'lot and Maya arguing) and Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain closed, isolating the sanctum). Because if the curtain was closed, Maya was inside with Tahrust, Zeh'lot outside. So they couldn't argue in the same space, and Tahrust couldn't hear them. Thus, the testimony is contradicted by the curtain evidence. 

Alternatively, Evidence 15 (Inner Sanctum Diagram) shows that Maya and Tahrust were in the sanctum, so Maya couldn't have been arguing with Zeh'lot outside. So Evidence 15 contradicts Testimony 3. 

Looking at the evidence list, Evidence 15 is the diagram. So perhaps that's the correct pair. 

Wait, but the user's answer must be in JSON format, like {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. So which evidence number is which? 

The Ritual Curtain is Evidence 4. The Inner Sanctum Diagram is 15. 

The key point is that during the rite, the curtain was closed, meaning the sanctum was isolated. So if Tahrust and Maya were inside, and the curtain was closed, then any altercation between Maya and Zeh'lot (who is outside) couldn't be heard by Tahrust. Therefore, Testimony 3 (hearing them argue) contradicts Evidence 4 (curtain closed). 

So the answer is {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}

Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Acolyte Fey channeled Lady Kee'ra's spirit.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 1
Testimony: She is a spirit medium who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name, so she could have done it.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, it was the real Lady Kee'ra who returned to root out the rebels among us.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 3
Testimony: She attacked and killed me with a strength far beyond any mortal woman.
Person: Tahrust

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other based on the given context. The user wants one pair. Let me start by going through the testimonies and cross-referencing with the evidence.

First, the testimonies are from Tahrust. Testimony 3 says that Lady Kee'ra attacked him with strength beyond any mortal woman. But looking at the evidence, the Tome of Secrets (Evidence 23) mentions that the priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. The tome also includes an image of the goddess holding a bird-shaped dagger, which is likely the Warbaa'd Dagger (Evidence 18). However, since Lady Kee'ra is a spirit and no one has seen her except through the tome, the real Lady Kee'ra's existence is only through representation. 

Wait, Tahrust claims in Testimony 3 that the real Lady Kee'ra attacked him. But according to the Tome of Secrets (Evidence 23), the representative must be a human priestess who knows her name and has seen her face. Since Lady Kee'ra is only a figure from the tome and not a real person, the attacker couldn't be the actual Lady Kee'ra but someone acting as her. Therefore, Tahrust's testimony that it was the real Lady Kee'ra contradicts the Tome's information that she's a role played by a human. So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 23. 

Another angle: The Tome says the representative must know the name Ihmsan and have seen her face. But since no one has seen Lady Kee'ra (from the context summary), the only way someone could act as her is by following the tome's instructions. So if Tahrust says the real Lady Kee'ra attacked, but the evidence shows she's a role played by a human (like Beh'leeb usually does), then Testimony 3 contradicts the Tome's existence as a guide for representatives, not the real goddess. 

Yes, that makes sense. The key contradiction is Tahrust claiming the real Lady Kee'ra attacked (Testimony 3), but the Tome (Evidence 23) establishes that she's a role requiring a human representative, not a real spirit. Therefore, the real Lady Kee'ra couldn't have physically attacked him, so the testimony and evidence clash.

{"evidence": 23, "testimony": 3}
